meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids were tuckering and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She was tuckering after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept tuckering itself out chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The long hike left me tuckering like never before.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout class had everyone tuckering by the end.

meanings.definition: To wrap or fold in a neat and secure way.
meanings.sent1: She was tuckering the gift with colorful wrapping paper.
meanings.sent2: He carefully tuckered the blanket around the baby to keep her warm.
meanings.sent3: The chef was tuckering the pastry dough into a perfect shape.
meanings.sent4: The artist tuckered the canvas around the wooden frame.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was tuckering the fabric to create a beautiful dress.

meanings.definition: A feeling of weariness or exhaustion.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, a sense of tuckering settled over him.
meanings.sent2: The tuckering from the busy week made her appreciate the weekend even more.
meanings.sent3: The tuckering from the exam left the students feeling drained.
meanings.sent4: The tuckering after the long flight made him want to rest immediately.
meanings.sent5: The tuckering from the long day at work made her look forward to a relaxing evening.
